pullRequest.body:
Add the more interesting direction of topology comparison for the Lévy-Prokhorov distance. Conclude that if the underlying space is separable, then the topology of convergence in distribution coincides with the one obtained from the Lévy-Prokhorov (pseudo)metric. In particular the topology of convergence in distribution is (pseudo)metrizable, and so first countable.

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion LevyProkhorov (ProbabilityMeasure Ω) := μ ```
This is another proposed but not strictly necessary API lemma about `biUnion`s. (See comments at `infEdist_biUnion`.)

This is a proposed but not strictly necessary API lemma about `biUnion`s.

I simply expected to find the `biUnion` version of the already existing lemma with `iUnion` by `exact?`, and I expected to be able to construct a term by `have foo := infEdist_biUnion arguments` (without explicitly spelling out the type).

But I realized later that `simp` can prove them. So I'm also happy to leave these `biUnion` variants of existing `iUnion` lemmas out of the PR, if the above reasons are not enough to make them natural or useful API additions.

It is not clear to me what is the optimal location for this lemma. It mixes topology and measure theory. `#find_home` just suggests the present file `MeasureTheory.Measure.LevyProkhorovMetric` and `#find_home!` suggests `MeasureTheory.Constructions.BorelSpace.Complex`, `MeasureTheory.Measure.Haar.OfBasis`.

I'd expect that the file `MeasureTheory.Constructions.BorelSpace.Basic` on Borel sigma algebras and `OpensMeasurableSpaces` should have approximately the right imports of topology and measure theory. However, this lemma is probably not core content there even if the necessary imports are in place there.

For the moment, the PR suggests to add the lemma here. Another natural option might be to create a new file about Borel spaces with separability assumption in the folder `MeasureTheory.Constructions.BorelSpace`. I'd also be happy to hear better suggestions.
For now I agree it makes sense to keep it here.

This strengthened import is necessary for the nontrivial direction of the comparison of the Lévy-Prokhorov topology and the weak convergence topology. So it was just a matter of time and should not be seen as import creep".

Perhaps this `have exhaust := ...` (together with a few things around it) would be reasonable to split off as a stand-alone lemma from the long proof. The right general lemma is the existing `tendsto_measure_iUnion`. But perhaps also a suitable special case of it deserves to be stand-alone, to facilitate applying it for example in cases where we have probability measures and partitions.
Is there a reason to have this condition in terms of `δ + ε` for positive `ε`, instead of in terms of `ε` for any `δ < ε`, like it is in other lemmas?
I changed to the `δ < ε` spellings. It is probably cleaner, indeed.
ditto

```suggestion
```
Is there a reason you're including the boundedness condition here, while it also follows from the next condition on the diameter?

My reason was stupid: it is often possible to superficially "achieve" the diameter less than a positive epsilon by making the sets in the partition unbounded so that the real junk value for `diam` is zero, and thus less than epsilon. The _conclusion_ of the lemma would then be useless (albeit true). Explicitly requiring boundedness rules out hitting junk values.

Perhaps the better way to handle this stupidity would have been to use `ediam` instead... Now that option actually seems more natural to me, but I believe back when I was writing this I was thinking that `diam` was less exotic than `ediam` and I therefore decided to phrase things using it.

If you have a clear recommendation on the preferred spelling, I will switch to it! I guess these types of choices should just be made as consistently in the library as possible. (And despite `ENNReal` being sometimes painful, for diameter it might well be the best choice. Hopefully the `finiteness` tactic from PFR will eventually aid in handling `ediam` as well.)
Ah, I had overlooked that! Maybe add a comment somewhere about that? Depending on your application, I'll let you judge if it is more efficient to switch to `ediam` or keep the current version.

I struggled a little trying to do the `EMetric.diam` version directly, probably due to my lack of familiarity with uniformities and possibly due to some missing API on emetric and uniformities (in particular I failed to find the analogue of `Metric.ball_eq_ball'` to close the remaining sorry below).

```
/-- In a separable pseudoemetric space, for any ε > 0 there exists a countable collection of
disjoint Borel measurable subsets of diameter at most ε that cover the whole space. -/
lemma SeparableSpace.exists_measurable_partition_ediam_le
    {X : Type*} [PseudoEMetricSpace X] [MeasurableSpace X] [OpensMeasurableSpace X]
    [SeparableSpace X] {ε : ℝ≥0∞} (ε_pos : 0 < ε) :
    ∃ (As : ℕ → Set X), (∀ n, MeasurableSet (As n)) ∧
        (∀ n, EMetric.diam (As n) ≤ ε) ∧ (⋃ n, As n = univ) ∧
        (Pairwise (fun (n m : ℕ) ↦ Disjoint (As n) (As m))) := by
  by_cases X_emp : IsEmpty X
  · refine ⟨fun _ ↦ ∅, fun _ ↦ MeasurableSet.empty, ?_, ?_, fun _ _ _ ↦ disjoint_of_subsingleton⟩
    · intro n
      simpa only [EMetric.diam_empty] using LT.lt.le ε_pos
    · simp only [iUnion_empty]
      apply Eq.symm
      simp only [univ_eq_empty_iff, X_emp]
  rw [not_isEmpty_iff] at X_emp
  obtain ⟨xs, xs_dense⟩ := exists_dense_seq X
  have half_ε_pos : 0 < ε / 2 := ENNReal.div_pos ε_pos.ne.symm two_ne_top
  set Bs := fun n ↦ EMetric.ball (xs n) (ε/2)
  set As := disjointed Bs
  set Bs := fun n ↦ EMetric.ball (xs n) (ε/2)
  set As := disjointed Bs
  refine ⟨As, ?_, ?_, ?_, ?_⟩
  · exact MeasurableSet.disjointed (fun n ↦ measurableSet_eball)
  · intro n
    apply (EMetric.diam_mono (disjointed_subset Bs n)).trans
    convert EMetric.diam_ball
    exact (ENNReal.mul_div_cancel' two_ne_zero two_ne_top).symm
  · have aux : ⋃ n, Bs n = univ := by
      convert DenseRange.iUnion_uniformity_ball xs_dense <| edist_mem_uniformity half_ε_pos
      simp only [Bs]
      -- ⊢ EMetric.ball (xs x✝) (ε / 2) = UniformSpace.ball (xs x✝) {p | edist p.1 p.2 < ε / 2}
      sorry
    simpa only [← aux] using iUnion_disjointed
  · exact disjoint_disjointed Bs
```

It is of course possible to deduce the `EMetric.diam` version from the version I stated originally (below). But at that point it is in my opinion already dubious whether the pros of `EMetric.diam` outweigh the extra hassle.

```
lemma ENNReal.truncateToReal_pos (z t : ℝ≥0∞) (z_pos : 0 < z) (t_pos : 0 < t) (h : z ≠ ∞ ∨ t ≠ ∞) :
    0 < z.truncateToReal t := by
  simp [ENNReal.truncateToReal]
  apply toReal_pos (lt_min z_pos t_pos).ne.symm
  rcases h with z_ne_top | t_ne_top
  · exact (lt_of_le_of_lt (min_le_left z t) z_ne_top.symm.lt_top').ne
  · exact (lt_of_le_of_lt (min_le_right z t) t_ne_top.symm.lt_top').ne

/-- In a separable pseudometric space, for any ε > 0 there exists a countable collection of
disjoint Borel measurable subsets of diameter at most ε that cover the whole space. -/
lemma SeparableSpace.exists_measurable_partition_ediam_le {ε : ℝ≥0∞} (ε_pos : 0 < ε) :
    ∃ (As : ℕ → Set Ω), (∀ n, MeasurableSet (As n)) ∧
        (∀ n, EMetric.diam (As n) ≤ ε) ∧ (⋃ n, As n = univ) ∧
        (Pairwise (fun (n m : ℕ) ↦ Disjoint (As n) (As m))) := by
  obtain ⟨As, As_mble, As_bdd, As_diam_le, As_cover, As_disj⟩ :=
    SeparableSpace.exists_measurable_partition_diam_le Ω
      <| ENNReal.truncateToReal_pos _ _ ε_pos zero_lt_one (Or.inr one_ne_top)
  refine ⟨As, As_mble, ?_, As_cover, As_disj⟩
  by_cases ε_top : ε = ∞
  · simp [ε_top]
  exact fun n ↦ (toReal_le_toReal (isBounded_iff_ediam_ne_top.mp (As_bdd n)) ε_top).mp
    <| le_trans (As_diam_le n) (truncateToReal_le ε_top)
```
```
I think I am inclined to keep the original spelling for now.
Since you are using `[SeparableSpace Ω]` in all the statements, maybe factor it out to the `variable` line? Maybe even move it before the previous lemma, so that it can take advantage of it?
When a proof is longer than 15/20 lines, it helps a lot to have comments explaining what is going on. I think this proof qualifies :-)

I wrote comments in this proof. I also split off a few standalone lemmas. And while writing comments and realizing that there was a long passage to convince Lean of a thing that was meant to be true by construction, I rephrased the construction and the related standalone lemma --- so the commenting probably resulted in a small improvement, too. And I think your suggested `δ < ε` spelling makes another small improvement here.

Sorry that the proof was probably horrendous to read and review in its original form! I hope it is better now.

```suggestion
    ProbabilityMeasure Ω ≃ₜ LevyProkhorov (ProbabilityMeasure Ω) where
```
It's strange to have a discrepancy between the two names, with `to` in the first one but not in the second one. Could you fix it, by changing the second one to `toProbabilityMeasure`?

```suggestion
  right_inv := congrFun rfl
```

```suggestion
  obtain ⟨i, hix⟩ : ∃ i, x ∈ Es i := by simp [← mem_iUnion, Es_union]
```
`obtain` is done exactly for this kind of situation!
Thanks! Yes, I had forgotten this more elegant syntax of `obtain`.

You can rewrite your union as the more readable `⋃ i ≥ n, Es i`.
I don't think you need `Es_union` for this lemma to be true, right? It looks like a consequence of `tendsto_measure_iInter` to me.

Yes, sorry! That hypothesis is indeed unnecessary, and the use of `tendsto_measure_iInter` golfs a few lines, and I agree it is a cleaner mathematical argument (no need to subtract). I fixed this. Thanks!
You shouldn't need `ε_ne_top` here.
No empty lines in proofs. The comments are already enough to separate the steps of the proof.

With `obtain`, you can make your proof more readable by making explicit the properties of `N` you will use, and also making it clear that this is an atomic proof step:
```suggestion
  obtain ⟨N, hN⟩ : ∃ N, (P : Measure Ω) (⋃ i ≥ N, Es i) < ENNReal.ofReal (ε / 3) := by
    have exhaust :=
      @tendsto_measure_biUnion_Ici_zero_of_pairwise_disjoint Ω _ P.toMeasure _ Es Es_mble Es_disjoint
    simp only [tendsto_atTop_nhds, Function.comp_apply] at exhaust
    obtain ⟨N, hN⟩ := exhaust (Iio (ENNReal.ofReal (ε / 3))) third_ε_pos' isOpen_Iio
    exact ⟨N, hN N le_rfl⟩ 
```

```suggestion
  have mem_nhds_P (G : Set Ω) (G_open : IsOpen G) : 
      {Q | P.toMeasure G < Q.toMeasure G + ENNReal.ofReal (ε/3)} ∈ 𝓝 P :=
    P.toMeasure_add_pos_gt_mem_nhds G_open third_ε_pos' ofReal_ne_top
```
You can move variables to the left of the colon in `have` statements.
Ah, I did not realize that `have` allows such syntax. Thanks!

```suggestion
  -- Fix an arbitrary set `B ⊆ Ω`, and an arbitrary `δ > 2*ε/3` to gain some room for error
  -- and for thickening.
  apply levyProkhorovDist_le_of_forall_le _ _ (by linarith) (fun δ B δ_gt _ ↦ ?_)
```
You can put the linarith and the intro step in the `apply`. The main advantage is that you can unindent the rest of your proof.

```suggestion
  rw [dist_comm]
```
shoud be enough.

```suggestion
    apply (measure_mono B_subset).trans ((measure_union_le _ _).trans ?_)
```

Since it's the only place you're using `hN`, I would even hide that in the obtain that gives you `N`: the defining property of `N` should be that `hN : P.toMeasure (⋃ j ∈ Iio N, Es j)ᶜ < ENNReal.ofReal (ε/3)`.
Thanks! This is clearly better style.

```suggestion
instance : PseudoMetrizableSpace (ProbabilityMeasure Ω) :=
```
Also, in this instance, instead of starting from a pseudometric space, it would be better to start from a pseudometrizable space, I think.

I did this, but my proof became very ugly. I kept getting `the synthesized type class is not definitionally equal to ...` until I really had spelled out each and every implicit type class argument in each piece, and in the end I managed to `convert` and rewrite with the equality of the clearly equal topologies...

```
/-- The topology of convergence in distribution on a separable space is pseudo-metrizable. -/
instance (X : Type*)
    [TopologicalSpace X] [PseudoMetrizableSpace X] [SeparableSpace X]
    [MeasurableSpace X] [OpensMeasurableSpace X]:
    PseudoMetrizableSpace (ProbabilityMeasure X) := by
  obtain ⟨psmetr, h⟩ := PseudoMetrizableSpace.exists_pseudo_metric (X := X)
  have opensMble : @OpensMeasurableSpace X psmetr.toUniformSpace.toTopologicalSpace _ := by
    convert ‹OpensMeasurableSpace X›
  have sepble : @SeparableSpace X psmetr.toUniformSpace.toTopologicalSpace := by
    convert ‹SeparableSpace X›
  let homeo := @homeomorph_probabilityMeasure_levyProkhorov X psmetr sepble _ opensMble
  have ind := @Homeomorph.inducing (ProbabilityMeasure X) (LevyProkhorov (ProbabilityMeasure X))
          (@ProbabilityMeasure.instTopologicalSpace X _
            psmetr.toUniformSpace.toTopologicalSpace opensMble) _ homeo
  convert @Inducing.pseudoMetrizableSpace (ProbabilityMeasure X)
          (LevyProkhorov (ProbabilityMeasure X))
          (@ProbabilityMeasure.instTopologicalSpace X _
            psmetr.toUniformSpace.toTopologicalSpace opensMble) _ _ _ ind
  exact h.symm
```

If you lookat the docstring of `PseudoMetrizableSpace`, you will see that it gives the advice to use `letI : PseudoMetricSpace X := TopologicalSpace.pseudoMetrizableSpacePseudoMetric X` to endow your space with a metric. With this metric, the topology is defeq to the original one, so all your problems should be solved and the original proof should work just fine.
Oh, indeed, thanks a lot!

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion exact ⟨N, hN N le_rfl⟩ ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion have mem_nhds_P (G : Set Ω) (G_open : IsOpen G) : ```

```suggestion
    {Q | P.toMeasure G < Q.toMeasure G + ε} ∈ 𝓝 P := by
```
